Define shaping variables

Source: R/plotting.R
INTERNAL_define_shape_variables.Rd

Generates the commands necessary to define the variables to shape by in the data.frame to be supplied to ggplot.

.define_shapeby_for_column_plot(param_choices, se)

.define_shapeby_for_row_plot(param_choices, se)

Arguments

param_choices

A single-row DataFrame that contains all the input settings for the current panel.
se

A SingleCellExperiment object.

Value

A list containing label, a string to use for labelling the shape scale; and cmds, a character vector of commands to add a ColorBy field to plot.data. Alternatively NULL, if no variable to shape by is specified.

Details

These functions generate commands to extract the variable to use for shaping individual points in row- or column-based plots, i.e., where each point is a feature or sample, respectively. The commands should be evaluated in the evaluation environment generated in .extract_plotting_data.

In these commands, the shaping variable is added to the plot.data data.frame in the ShapeBy field. This is distinct from .add_shape_to_*_plot, which generates the commands for shaping a ggplot by the values in ColourBy.

See also

.extract_plotting_data

Contents

  • Value
  • Details
